Name:
HMS Bryony
Polarfront II
Builder: Harland and Wolff, Belfast, Northern Ireland
Out of service: Sold to the Royal Norwegian Navy in 1948
Motto:
Quid habeo idem teneo
(Latin: "What I Have, the same I hold")
Propulsion:
Two fire tube boilers
one 4-cycle triple-expansion steam engine
Range: 3,500 nautical miles at 12 knots (6,500 km at 22 km/h)
Armament:
1 × BL 4-inch (101.6 mm) Mk IX gun, 
2 × .50 inch (12.7 mm) twin machine guns, 
2 × .303 inch (7.7-mm) Lewis machine guns 
2 × stern depth charge racks with 40 depth charges
